description: From Old French abestos, from Latin asbestos, itself from Ancient Greek ἄσβεστος (ásbestos, “unquenchable, inextinguishable”), from ᾰ̓- (a-, “not”) + σβέννῡμῐ (sbénnūmi, “I quench, quell”).

nouns.description: asbestos (countable and uncountable, plural asbestoses or (rare) asbesti)

entries.meaning: (mineralogy) Any of several fibrous mineral forms of magnesium silicate, used for fireproofing, electrical insulation, building materials, brake linings, chemical filters, suits, fireman's gloves, etc.
examples: All types of asbestos are potentially carcinogenic when inhaled.

entries.meaning: (mineralogy) Any of asbestos-like forms of several minerals, asbestiforms

verbs.description: asbestos (third-person singular simple present asbestoses, present participle asbestosing, simple past and past participle asbestosed)

entries.meaning: To coat or line with asbestos.
To expose to asbestos; to cause to suffer asbestosis.
